Intercepted in the wild: a suspect RSA message encrypted with a modulus built from two Blum integers. Can you recover the flag? Ciphertext: 3990744285842771091363832976359736359707387959328891786010031435045706120834692858000866789608205155771720132822605162678062540598199636839532241734850385

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{e65y86gm}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3990744285842771091363832976359736359707387959328891786010031435045706120834692858000866789608205155771720132822605162678062540598199636839532241734850385
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8492956836860807576484646024563651455541915310947575123403954868034705922691752652927169739854965237983068607123438993914014389065988410220765568524566209, e=1260775776602935626273718369311360578072884161760118838294644060275524916183466934361558412659022248965715891634749611606377198810353181910955859709594953
The lower 104 bits of p are: 66426024496445678046407998864083563855

extra_info: p=102270790000620468252936358899951692299051233984312081273075015855709480727887, q=83043817661027958462268087113637924488794605158941764129634681476046961633007, Ï†(n)=8492956836860807576484646024563651455541915310947575123403954868034705922691567338319508091428250033537055017506651148074871135220585700523433812082205316
